bullets.text: Stocks edge higher as investors brace for Nvidia results, keeping AI-driven market leadership under scrutiny.
New York Fed met Wall Street on a key lending facility, signaling possible liquidity backstop tweaks.
401(k) hardship withdrawals more than doubled, underscoring acute household cash strain and deteriorating retirement security.
Medicare Part B premiums to rise 10% in 2026, eroding roughly one-third of Social Security COLA.
Chevron and Exxon plan continued production growth despite cheaper crude, prioritizing volumes and efficiency; potential cap on future oil prices.
U.S. imposing steep tariffs on Italian pasta could double prices, straining consumers and escalating transatlantic trade tensions.
Japan’s economy contracted less than expected; China’s travel warning hit Japan tourism-exposed stocks, reflecting rising Beijing-Tokyo tensions.
Trump-style candidate advances to Chilean runoff, signaling right-populist momentum and policy uncertainty on crime, migration, and markets.
U.S. strike on boat in the Pacific killed three, highlighting expanding maritime operations and escalation risks.
Extreme floods are cutting global rice yields faster than expected, threatening food security and inflation across importing nations.
Expiry of key LFP battery patents opens competition, likely reducing EV costs and diversifying battery supply chains.
Single-beam photonic AI system claims supercomputer-class performance, hinting at future energy-efficient compute for data centers.
Buy Now, Pay Later usage surges, raising consumer-credit risk and regulatory scrutiny as delinquencies climb.
